availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James C. Fidler (Anderson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Susan M. Gudgell Fidler in Anderson County on October 1, 1850. Father of Ezra Fidler. Gustavus Fidler, and Sarah Fidler. Hemp manufacturer in Anderson County in 1850. Employed Samuel G. Fidler as a hemp spinner and Peter Miller as a rope spinner in Anderson County in 1850. Owned twenty enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Anderson County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in 1860. Farmer in Anderson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County. p. 84.

Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), Anderson County 1842-1893, Film # 000259310, p. 749.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 4th Congressional District, Vol. 3, 1863, p. 64, p. 66 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on May 6, 2020).
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Anderson County Administrator Bonds, 1852-1869, p. 192 of microfilm (Accessed through ancestry.com on May 6, 2020).
